How to use Aspirin

Introduction
Aspirin is one of the most widely used nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) in the world. It is an acetylsalicylic acid derivative that blocks the enzyme COX-1, which is responsible for the production of inflammatory prostaglandins. Aspirin is used to treat a wide range of conditions, including rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and ankylosing spondylitis. It is also used to treat symptoms of acute and chronic pain in conditions such as migraine, headaches, and postoperative pain. In this blog, we will explain the benefits and uses of Aspirin, as well as common side effects and warnings.

What is Aspirin?
